meanings.definition: Bejeebers (noun): The feeling of extreme fear or surprise.
meanings.sent1: The loud thunderstorm outside scared the bejeebers out of the little girl.
meanings.sent2: I nearly jumped out of my skin when the spider crawled out from under the bed, scaring the bejeebers out of me.
meanings.sent3: The horror movie was so intense that it scared the bejeebers out of everyone in the theater.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected sound of the fire alarm going off sent the bejeebers running through my veins.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house was designed to scare the bejeebers out of anyone who dared to enter.

meanings.definition: Bejeebers (verb): To scare or startle someone greatly.
meanings.sent1: The sudden burst of fireworks bejeebered the dog, causing it to run and hide under the bed.
meanings.sent2: The prankster jumped out from behind the door, bejeebering his friend who was lost in thought.
meanings.sent3: The surprise birthday party was planned to bejeeber the guest of honor when she walked in.
meanings.sent4: The ghost costume was so realistic that it bejeebered the trick-or-treaters as they approached the house.
meanings.sent5: The loud crash of thunder bejeebered the cat, making it dart under the couch in fear.
